om.question
Class Results

java.lang.Object
  om.question.Results

public class Results
extends java.lang.Object

Question results (scores)

API CLASS: This class is used in SOAP returns and should probably not be altered (after initial release).

Method Detail

getQuestionLine

public java.lang.String getQuestionLine()
Returns:
One-line summary of question (may be null)

getAnswerLine

public java.lang.String getAnswerLine()
Returns:
One-line summary of answer (may be null)

getActionSummary

public java.lang.String getActionSummary()
Returns:
Summary of user actions (may be null)

getAttempts

public int getAttempts()
Returns:
Number of attempts taken to get correct answer; 1=first attempt. ATTEMPTS_PASS(0)=user passed, ATTEMPTS_WRONG(-1)=user failed all attempts, ATTEMPTS_UNSET(-99)=value has not been set

setQuestionLine

public void setQuestionLine(java.lang.String sText)
                     throws OmDeveloperException
Sets the one-line question summary.

Example: 'Select 5 equations equivalent to 4n.'

Where possible, the summary should define the specific question asked. However, some questions may be impossible to accurately summarise in a single line.

Parameters:
sText - One-line question summary
Throws:
OmDeveloperException - If sText is longer than 255 characters

setAnswerLine

public void setAnswerLine(java.lang.String sText)
                   throws OmDeveloperException
Sets the one-line answer summary.

Example: 'Mean 0.45, Median 0, Mode 1'

Where possible, the summary should define the specific answer the user gave. In some cases this may be impossible, for reasons of length or the text-only format.

Parameters:
sText - One-line answer summary
Throws:
OmDeveloperException - If sText is longer than 255 characters

appendActionSummary

public void appendActionSummary(java.lang.String sText)
Appends text to the action summary. This is a longer summary of the user's actions, intended for admin view only. Supposing they get a question right on the third try, this would typically include the first and second answers too. It is not restricted in length (though shouldn't be ridiculous) and may contain any other information about the question that should be recorded for easy access by admin staff.

Parameters:
sText - Additional information that will be appended to the action summary. (You don't need to end with whitespace; a newline is automatically included at the end of each entry.)

setScore

public void setScore(int iMarks,
                     int iAttempts)
              throws OmDeveloperException
Sets the question numerical result (on default score axis).

Parameters:
iMarks - Marks obtained
iAttempts - Attempts taken to get result, or an ATTEMPTS_xx constant
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

setScore

public void setScore(java.lang.String sAxis,
                     int iMarks)
              throws OmDeveloperException
Sets the question numerical result (on specified score axis). If a result has already been set in a particular axis, that result is replaced. When calling this method, be sure to set the attempts value as well.

Parameters:
sAxis - Score axis ID (null = default)
iMarks - Marks obtained
Throws:
OmDeveloperException - If axis name is not a valid ID

setAttempts

public void setAttempts(int iAttempts)
Sets the number of attempts taken to get question right. Must be called if setting score on individual axes; can be set as part of setScore for single-axis results.

Parameters:
iAttempts - 1 = user got question right on first attempt, etc.; or use an ATTEMPTS_xx constant

setCustomResult

public void setCustomResult(java.lang.String sName,
                            java.lang.String sValue)
                     throws OmDeveloperException
Sets a custom question result. Custom results are not interpreted by the test navigator but may be analysed in later processing.

Parameters:
sName - Name (ID) for result
sValue - Value of result
Throws:
OmDeveloperException - If name isn't a valid ID string

getScores

public Score[] getScores()
Returns:
All question scores that have been set.

getCustomResults

public CustomResult[] getCustomResults()
Returns:
All custom results.
